info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 10 at 7:20AM CDT until June 10 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT FOR NORTHERN CLARK...CENTRAL PIKE...SOUTHWESTERN GARLAND... SOUTHWESTERN HOT SPRING AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 720 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Meyers to 7 miles west of DeGray Lake State Park to 7 miles south of Amity, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Arkadelphia... Mount Ida... Glenwood... Mountain Pine... Amity... Caddo Valley... Okolona... Daisy... Gum Springs in Clark County... Daisy State Park... Narrows Dam... Meyers... Lofton... Rockwell... DeGray Lake State Park... Hot Springs Memorial Field... Halfway... Hot Springs National Park... Friendship... This includes Interstate 30 between mile markers 63 and 87. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
